cardList.extended_caption: We can look again at a painting we have seen previously — Gérôme’s Duel After the Masquerade — to see the effect of inherent lines. This format is called a root 2 rectangle, as previously discussed in Chapter 4, with proportions of 1:√2.

cardList.title: Impressionist’s palette: Cadmium Yellow Light, Cadmium Yellow Deep, Cadmium Orange, Cadmium Red Light, Alizarin Crimson, Cobalt Violet, Ultramarine Blue, Cerulean Blue, and Viridian.
cardList.credit: Gamblin Artists Colors Co.

cardList.title: Modern/Spectral Palette: Hansa Yellow Light, Hansa Yellow Medium, Hansa Yellow Deep, Mono Orange, Napthol Scarlet, Quinacridone Red, Quinacridone Violet, Dioxazine Purple, Phthalo Blue, Manganese Blue Hue, Phthalo Green, and Phthalo Emerald.
cardList.credit: Gamblin Artists Colors Co.
